intro: Macreightia caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
